dmca.title: IFPI DMCA (Copyright) Complaint to Google
dmca.body:
Email

thankyoumusic.blogspot.com


-- 
Alice Wu | Web Products | Legal Support
Google Inc. | 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway
Mountain View | CA | 94043
650.253.0688 voice | 650.618.1806 facsimile alicewu@google.com

Dear Sir/Madam,

Third Notice of infringement of copyright in sound recordings by a Google
AdSense subscriber

We refer to our email of 20 May and 29 May 2008 below.

Despite our two earlier notifications, the specified infringements of IFPI
Represented Companiesâ€™ exclusive rights by a Google AdSense subscriber are
continuing.  IFPI therefore again repeats its request for your urgent
assistance in relation to this activity.

Notice of infringement of copyright in sound recordings by a Google AdSense
subscriber

As you are aware, IFPI, International Federation of the Phonographic
Industry represents over 1,400 record producers in over 75 countries around
the world. IFPI also has affiliated industry organisations in 49 countries
worldwide. As part of this work, we monitor the Internet and take action
regarding the use of music in a manner that infringes rights in sound
recordings owned or controlled by our members and certain other record
companies (the â€œIFPI Represented Companiesâ€).

Please note that we have a signature on file with Google.

IFPI hereby notifies Google of the infringement of IFPI Represented
Companiesâ€™ exclusive rights by a Google AdSense subscriber.

1.      We have established that, amongst others, the IFPI Representative
Company-owned copyright sound recordings referred to below are being
infringed by their unauthorised reproduction and/or making available via
the following website:

http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com (the "Infringing Website")

The Infringing Website carries advertising supplied by Google.

2.      By way of example only, without authorisation the Infringing
Website is making available sound files containing the following IFPI
Represented Company-owned copyright sound recordings via the following
locations on the Infringing Website:


URL: http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/05/danity-kane-charlotte-
sometimes-ting.html
URL: http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/05/santogold-incognito-last-
shadow-puppets.html
URL: http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/05/santogold-incognito-last-
shadow-puppets.html

3.      We can be contacted in relation to this notices via the following
contact details:

E-mail: [redacted]ifpi.org

IFPI
[redacted]
London W1J 0DD

United Kingdom

Tel: +44 (0)20 7878 7900
Fax: +44 (0)[redacted]


4.      We have a good faith belief that use of the copyright materials as
described above is not authorised by the copyright owner, its agent or the
law.


5.      We assert that the information in this notice is accurate, based on
the data available to us.  We submit under penalty of perjury that IFPI is
authorised to act on behalf of the owner of the exclusive rights that are
allegedly infringed.

We hereby request your immediate assistance in relation to this activity on
a Google AdSense supported website.  Specifically, we request that Google
immediately withdraws the provision of the Google AdSense services to the
Infringing Website by terminating the relevant subscriber and informs the
site operator of the illegality of his or her conduct.



By submitting a notice in this form (as required by Google) regarding the
AdSense services provided by Google and the infringement of copyright
described above, IFPI neither admits nor accepts that Google is a 'service
provider' for the purposes of the DMCA nor that it is necessary to serve or
that Google is entitled to be served a notice in compliance with the DMCA.
IFPI itself and on behalf of the IFPI Represented Companies hereby
expressly reserves all rights in this regard.



In addition, this notice does not constitute a waiver of any right to
recover damages incurred by virtue of any unauthorised activities described
in this notice, and such rights as well as claims for other relief are
hereby expressly reserved.



Thank you for your co-operation.



Yours faithfully



[redacted]

Vice-President, Internet Anti-Piracy

Tel: +44 (0)20 7878 7900

Fax: +44 (0)[redacted]

E-mail: jeremy.banks@ifpi.org

Website: www.ifpi.org
